channel.title: code on Austin Delamar
channel.description: Recent content in code on Austin Delamar

item.title: Java Web Frameworks 2017
item.description: I've been researching Java frameworks lately, trying to find one that's easy to extend and lightweight enough for RESTful APIs. In my search I've seen all kinds of names thrown around in recent forums and old StackOverflow answers. So I thought I'd compile my findings in one big list.

item.title: Some Advice on Docker as a Beginner
item.description: Docker and containers in general are great. Containers are like mini virtual machines that run only the bare essentials of an operating system. And it accomplishes this at a fraction of the resources required than a regular virutal machine. This makes Docker containers ideal for many uses, such as web servers, microservices, and more.

item.title: Shortest FizzBuzz Solution in Java?
item.description: Count from 1 to 100, and follow these rules: - Print "Fizz" if the number is divisible by 3 - Print "Buzz" if the number is divisible by 5 - Print "FizzBuzz" if the number is divisible by 3 and 5

item.title: Java Frameworks and the Effort they might save or create
item.description: Java is a nice programming language. But Java/J2EE websites can grow to be very complex in a short amount of time. One of the biggest areas of discussion about J2EE development today is about the many kinds of frameworks that can be implemented with your project, and what valuable features they provide, or amount of work they chop down.
